instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Flashing folder
threads.message:
Hi I received a board with a missing display connector. I replaced it with a new one. Yesterday it booting fine. But today it’s not boot in to any hdd or OS X. :( I’ve swapped it twice with two hdd and two SATA flex cables know good. Checked  the fl4510 and caps <CAPACITOR>C4511</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C4510</CAPACITOR>
I have 5v at SATA connector pins 9,11. The fl4510 has continuity from terminals 1-2, 3-4. The <CHIP>U4510</CHIP> area is spotless. <SIGNAL>SATARDRVR_A_EN</SIGNAL> =3.4v
<SIGNAL>SMC_ODD_DETECT</SIGNAL> =3.3v
at <RESISTOR>R4590</RESISTOR> I have a value of 20k ohm and the schematic says 33k.
Lastly it won’t pram reset and it also has a weird issue that it won’t respond to power key from time to time while powering on but will always power off with no issue if that means anything. I also swapped it with another keyboard and power button. Just to be sure.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Flashing folder
threads.message: Can you boot from USB OSX?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Flashing folder
threads.message:
I will have to make a new usb tonight. 
Let me ask you. I have a OS X Lion disk handy Will that work In the meanwhile? I understand that  the dvd/hdd might work together but maybe the dvd drive can help me diagnose?  Both the dvd drive and hdd drive spin up.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Flashing folder
threads.message: You can try to boot from DVD disc, if available...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Flashing folder
threads.message: Ok so I tried a usb and boot disk it won’t boot. When I hold option key it has a efi lock :/ would this give me my symptoms ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Flashing folder
threads.message: I have a programmer. do you think a clean bios would fix this :/ I’m assuming I would just replace the password with the code inside a clean bios would I be correct in thinking I could use the blank code it basically a “place holder” to flash efi lock ? I’m sorry I never encountered this problem the salvage company says they don’t have it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Flashing folder
threads.message:
Ok it worked. How can I test for the kernel panic issue this board suffer From?
Like what does it do ? I have another one of these from the same company. But it’s missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>. I will start a new. Thread for that one

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Flashing folder
threads.message: Now boots and get kernel panic?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Flashing folder
threads.message: No it doesn’t it seems to run fine but I was wondering how would I test for a kernel panic ? I looked it up on the internet and it say no video or video issues and freezing.  are there any other symptoms? By the way thanks a lot for your help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Flashing folder
threads.message: Change <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>; do NOT use hot air...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Flashing folder
threads.message:
Thanks informatico it wasn’t kernel panic Ming but why risk it I just switched it out 
Thank you for your help
